title: A request for the upcoming Clash gamemode
body:
Either give everyone access to all champions, or allow people to share champions.
The events are only on weekends and are on at set times, so it wouldn't be like giving people champions for free. If you want to give all players access to a competitive experience like this, then let us either have all champions or share champions so that we can have our teammates pick champions for us.
I think this would vastly improve the quality of the upcoming gamemode.

Umm... I like that for the spirit of competition, but if Clash is the ONLY place players can try out all the champions, then it may become the GOTO place for people to try out champions they don't own. I could see players possibly wandering into the mode not really caring about anything but "oh I get to try Yasuo here without buying him" and making for very un-competitive matches.

I feel like opening up all champions to practice mode where players are restricted to only interact with bots might be a good companion to this feature to create a better place in the game for that kind of activity. Maybe that's an idea from HotS worth copying.
I don't think that'll be an issue. If I understood right you get to pick out your teammates, so you won't get thrown in a team with a random 1st time Yasuo

That's honestly your problem... If he is literally gonna troll then just play normals, clash cost be/rp and can only be played a select time you have to take it seriously or it won't even be fun.
There's a blue essence/rp buy in so it's unlikely this will be a widespread issue and I'm sure devs will have measures in place to discourage it.

Make it too expensive and people won't participate if it means a significant risk of significantly slowing their champ unlocks (and less participation hurts the experience for everyone). I'm not sure if that will be a hard balance to strike or not, although I guess Riot has data for how much people engage with the renting system on shards which is functionally kind of similar.

It's not meant for randoms to casually play in. This mode is meant for pre-made teams of five to put their skills to the test against others of what hopefully is other teams of comparable skill. 

No one should ever be using this mode to 'try out' champions. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

A competitive team of solo players makes no sense. Hence asking for solo Clash makes no sense. Nothing prevents you from creating a team of people you don't know and play Clash with them, but you won't be able to climb since the mode is designed for competitive teams.
